results.title: Trobriand cricket
results.brief_description: A fascinating ethnographic documentary about cultural creativity among the people of the Trobriand Islands. The film shows how the islanders have adapted the game of cricket - first introduced by Methodist missionaries - into an outlet for mock warfare and inter-village competition, chanting and an expression of the islanders’ experience of colonialism.
results.description: A fascinating ethnographic documentary about cultural creativity among the people of the Trobriand Islands. results.title: Triumph of the will. - [Short version]
results.brief_description: Triumph of the will is the official film record of the Sixth Nazi Party Congress (Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Reichsparteitag) held at Nuremberg, Germany, September 4 to 10, 1934. It was created by Leni Riefenstahl at the order of Hitler. The purpose of the film was propagandistic, and as propaganda, it is an historical landmark which may never be equalled. It is also a visually beautiful film - showing the supreme pageantry of the Congress and capturing the enthusiasm of the huge crowds (men, women and children of all ages) who took part. This version is rather disjointed owing to the editing of the original version which ran for over two hours. As an example of German filmmaking of the period, it is unequalled. The various parades and ceremonies are shown and many of the leaders of the Party who later became so well known are seen. Hitler is also shown giving some of his speeches which receive a startling reception. German dialogue with some English subtitles.

results.title: Triumph of the nomads
results.creator_credit: Nomad Films International, Douglas Stanley and David Morgan
results.brief_description: Ancient Australia is often seen as a land of stagnation and the early Australians were depicted as one of the most primitive peoples on earth. However, this program examines how the long Aboriginal occupation of Australia witnessed spectacular changes. Generations of Aborigines saw the great rising of the seas which isolated Australia; they saw, and probably influenced, sweeping changes in vegetation and wildlife. The Aborigines created a lifestyle which suited their environment. They were skilled herbalists and master trappers and hunters. Their nomadic wanderings followed a logical pattern, reflecting their forethought and knowledge of the land. Narrated by Geoffrey Blainey.

results.title: Tristan und Isolde
results.brief_description: A magnificent production by the Bayreuther Festspiele, under the direction of Daniel Barenboim and Jean-Pierre Ponnelle. Tristan, sung by Rene Kollo, and Isolde by Johanna Meier tells the tale of two fated lovers who are caught up in a web of intrigue. Ultimately the fulfillment of their love comes through death and transfiguration.

results.title: Tristan and Isolt = Lovespell
results.creator_credit: Clar Productions, Tom Hayes, Claire Labine and Tom Donovan
results.brief_description: A celtic medieval story of love, betrayal and tragedy within a 9th century Irish monarchy. Stars Richard Burton (Mark, King of Cornwall), Kate Mulgrew (Isolt), Nicholas Clay (Tristan) with Cyril Cusack, Geraldine Fitzgerald and Niall Toibin. Music by The Chieftains.

results.title: Triple word score [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Armagan Ballantyne
results.brief_description: Sisters Phyllis and Hazel prefer to communicate via the Scrabble board. When a stranger joins their midst, albeit briefly, they are forced to question their circumstances, and the nature of their relationship. Cast includes Iris Shand, Dorothy Cox and Ben Gabriel.

results.title: Triple trouble
results.creator_credit: Essanay Film Manufacturing Company, Charles Chaplin and Leo White
results.brief_description: A slapstick comedy starring Charlie Chaplin as a screwball kitchenhand who unwittingly foils Colonel W. Nutt’s scientific research and in the process involves everyone around him in a search for local train robbers. Also stars: Billy Armstrong, Albert Austin, Henry Bergman, Bud Jamison, James J. Kelley, ‘Snub’ Pollard, Edna Purviance, Wesley Ruggles and Leo White.

results.title: Tripe. Sharkey's party
results.creator_credit: Lawless Enterprises, Peter Lawless and Greg Woodland
results.brief_description: Tripe (1985): Gothic spoof in which four grown children read cookbooks for pleasure having been fed a steady diet of tripe by their domineering father and Victorian aunt Esme - until things get even blacker. Cast includes John Meillon, Gary Waddell, Sally McKenzie, Cate Brennan, Tim Ailwood and Steve Houston. “Sharkey’s Party” (1986): A less angst counterpoint to “Dogs in Space”. Having just come out of a mental institiution Sharkey’s friends throw him a party. Musicians, jaded punks, out-of-date hippies, sharehouses, drugs and life on the dole make up this portrayal of Australian youth culture in the 1980’s. Cast includes David Argue and Sally McKenzie.
